attributes.action: Perform DBS Checks on all prospective MP candidates and publish the results.
attributes.additional_details: If you want to employ someone for a sensitive position or position that could put security at risk by law a DBS check has to be done. This is to ensure that if there is evidence that someone may be a danger to security or a section of the public that their prospective employers have a the information to ensure that those who are a danger are not employed in sensitive fields. Making DBS checks compulsory for MP would assist the electorate in avoiding electing those likely to be criminals.
attributes.background: DBS checks are used to ensure that someone is likely to be safe to employ to sensitive or secure positions. Many positions where a prospective employee has power over vulnerable groups or information, require one of these checks by law. (childminders, security guards etc.)

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The vetting of parliamentary candidates are the responsibility of political parties.
